alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe; Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 12:18AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Monroe, Lenawee and southern Washtenaw Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1217 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Vandercook Lake to near Hillsdale to near Reading. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Addison and Cement City around 1230 AM EDT. Hudson around 1235 AM EDT. Onsted and Clayton around 1240 AM EDT. Manchester around 1245 AM EDT. Adrian and Tecumseh around 1250 AM EDT. Ann Arbor and Britton around 1255 AM EDT. Saline and Blissfield around 100 AM EDT. Ypsilanti, Milan, Dundee, Petersburg and Deerfield around 105 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Whittaker, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway, Palmyra, Pleasant Lake, Sand Creek, Azalia and Medina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
